title: Welcome to our project

Contenu de la page…
Bonjour

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Explications
Our project will focus on the following question: “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?”.
The goal is to analyze whether this sporting event, which took place in July 2023, had a significant effect on cycling in the city and if there were notable changes in cycling habits.

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Data

To conduct this study, we have chosen to analyze data on bicycle usage spanning from April to October 2023. This time frame allows us to examine bike traffic before, during, and after the Tour de France, providing a comprehensive view of usage patterns around this event. The selection of this period is crucial for capturing short-term trends related to the Tour and distinguishing them from seasonal or contextual factors that might also influence cycling behavior.

title: Welcome to our project  bike analyses in Montpellier
text:
Introduction

Problematic

Our project will focus on the following question: “What is the impact of the 2023 Tour de France on bicycle usage in Montpellier, and how have cyclists’ behaviors evolved before and after this major event?”.



Goal

The goal is to analyze whether this sporting event, which took place in July 2023, had a significant effect on cycling in the city and if there were notable changes in cycling habits.



Hypothesis

En nous basant sur des donnes ???, nus avons fait comme hypothèse qu’il y aurait une fréquentation plus importante de vélos à Montpellier aux alentours des périodes du Tour de France. En effet, nous pensons qu’un évènement tel que le celui-ci peut inciter les gens à prendre leur vélo, que ce soit juste avant cet évènement, pendant, ou juste après cet évènement. De plus, nous pensons que ces effets ne sont pas répercutés sur une grande période avant et après et qu’ils se dissipent rapidement.

We may collect the following types of information: Personal Information: Name, email address, phone number (when you fill out a form or subscribe to our newsletter). Usage Data: Information on how you use our site (e.g., pages visited, time spent on the site).

4. Your Rights

5. Contact Us

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at your email address.

title: About us
text:
Introduction

Welcome to BikeProjectTeam7. .


1. The team

Nous sommes une équipe de 4 personnes étudiants à la Faculté des Sciences de Montpellier. Nous sommes actuellemnt en première année de Master en Statistiques et Sciences des Données. Nous réalisons ce projet dans le cadre de l’unité d’enseignement ‘Développement logiciel’.


Vous pouvez retrouver dans notre équipe :

Samira : qui a participé aux rédactions des Readme et à la création de la vidéo.
Anne-Laure : qui a participé à la création de la maquette du site web et à la création des prédictions des cartes.
Qinjian : qui a participé à la visualisation de la carte et à la création des tracés sur la carte.
Emilie : qui a participé à la réalisation du diagramme de Gantt et à la création du site web.



Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir pu réaliser ce projet et espérons que ce site web vous plapit également.


Si vous avez des questions n’hésitez pas à nous contacter par mail (adresse mail sous le format : prénom.nom@etu.umontpellier.fr). Nous serons ravie d’essayer d’apporter des réponses à vos questions.


Enjoy!

title: Statistics
text:
Introduction

On this page, we present a statistical analysis of bicycle traffic data in Montpellier from April to October 2023.



Just before the Tour de France.


During the Tour de France.


Just after the Tour de France.



To answer this question, we used the collected data (described on the homepage) to perform statisctical analyses that would confirm or refute our initial hypothesis. We expected to observe an increase in bicycle usage during the Tour de France due to the popularity of the event and its potential influence on local behaviour.

title: Statistics
text: Méthode

title: Statistics
text: Résultats

title: Statistics
text:
Discussion

The analyses indicate that the Tour de France did not have a significant effect on bicycle traffic in Montpellier in 2023. Instead, the observed variations seems to align more closely with the summer vacation period, which generally starts at the beginning of July and lasts until the end of August. We noticed a decrease in bicycle usage during this time, foloowed by a marked increase from September onwards, likely corresponding to the return to school and work after the holidays.


These findings suggest that bicycle usage patterns in Montpellier are more influenced by the school calendar and typical work periods than by occasional sporting events like the Tour de France, execpt when the event directly passes through the city, which was not the case in 2023.

title: Statistics
text:
Conclusion

Our hypothesis that the Tour de France would significantly increase bicycle traffic in Montpellier was not supported by the data. Instead, the influence of the summer vacation period was much more pronounced. For further research, it would be interesting to analyze data over multiple years, especially when the Tour de France stage passes through Montpellier, to see of a stronger local effect can be observed in these circumstances.

Classes

“Text”

In the website, we have used the class named “text”.


This class is used in all sections to organize and style all paragraphs, in the same way as personalising titles, in the website. It controls :



color : for the choice of the text color : black.


text-align : for the choice of the text alignement : justify.


font-family : for the choice of font : Lato, sans serif.


font-size : for the choice of text size : 15px.


font-weight : for the choice of the text weight (level of bold) : 500.


margin-bottom : for the choice of the spacing between paragraphs : 1em.



This class is defined in the styles.css file.

title: Statistics
text:
Methods

We used cleaned data files that recorded the daily number of cyclists in Montpellier, and compiled them into a single dataset. The statistical analyses focused on the following periods :



Before the Tour de France : April to June.


During the Tour de France : July 1st to July 23rd.


After the Tour de France : late July to October.



The data were aggregated by day and by month to compute the mean and standard deviation of the intensity of bicycle traffic. Temporal trends were visualized using line plots, and we compared descriptive statistics for each period. Additionally, we considered the potential impact of the summer vacation period, which partially overlaps with the Tour de France dates.

!Graph!

This graph below shows the averag daily intensity of bicycle traffic from April to October 2023, highlighting the period of the Tour de France.

title: Statistics
text:
Results

The results indicate changes in bicycle usage throughout the study period. We observed that the average daily bicycle count before July was ?X cyclist per day?, compared to ?Y cyclists par day? during the Tour de France, and ?Z cyclists per day? after de Tour de France.


The computed standard deviations for these periods were similar, suggesting comparable variability in bicycle usage before, during, and after the Tour de France. Howevers, no significant differences were observed between the means of the different periods, indicating that the event did not have a substantial impact on bicycle usage in Montpellier.

!Graph!

This graph represent the average monthly bicycle traffic allowing us to observe broader rends across the entire period of analysis.
